extensionAttribute.scriptContentsMac:
#!/bin/bash # # # Created by A.Hodgson # Date: 2/28/2020 # Purpose: Report on the number of profiles with text in the username area (ISD11 doesn't deploy at the user leve). # If the count is > 0 then there is a problem with the device record and the device needs to be re-enrolled. # # ######################################
#################### Jamf Pro Variables #################### JAMF_USER="API_User" # Full Jamf Pro admin username JAMF_PASS="v5yxGK=3WP#bXkAX" # Jamf Pro admin password JAMF_URL="https://jss.anoka.k12.mn.us:8443" # Full Jamf Pro URL including port, no trailing slash please; ex. https://jamf.com:8443
#################### Main Function ####################
# get device serial sn=$(system_profiler SPHardwareDataType | awk '/Serial/ {print $4}') #sn=C02KP9RGDNCR
# get devices from the saved adv search device_info=$(curl -sku $JAMF_USER:$JAMF_PASS -H "Accept: application/xml" $JAMF_URL/JSSResource/computers/serialnumber/"$sn")
# create a template file to parse the XML response cat << EOF > /tmp/stylesheet.xslt <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"> <xsl:output method="text"/> <xsl:template match="/"> <xsl:value-of select="count(computer/configuration_profiles/configuration_profile/name[text()])"/> <xsl:text> </xsl:text> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet> EOF
# parse the API response and output the desired values based on the template above reported_profile_count=$( echo "$device_info" | xsltproc /tmp/stylesheet.xslt - ) # need to "convert" the output to a number so the IF statement correctly evaluates reported_profile_count=$((reported_profile_count+0))
if [ "$reported_profile_count" -gt 0 ]; then echo "<result>Detected</result>" else echo "<result>Not Detected</result>" fi
#exit script gracefully exit 0
